sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Crypto had a rough November. The pain is persisting into December — and that could signal trouble ahead for the stock market.

hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major policy speech, CPI print), a sharp, high-volume initial price move followed by 2-4 hours of compressed, low-range consolidation within 0.5 ATR of the post-news high/low will lead to a continuation move in the original direction of the news reaction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news creates a new information equilibrium. The initial surge represents the 'news discounting,' while the subsequent compression represents institutional absorption and order book rebuilding. A failure to retrace suggests the new price level is accepted, leading to algorithmic momentum chasing once compression breaks.
entry_conditions: High-impact news event identified (e.g., Fed speech, election result, major regulatory announcement)
Initial 1-hour post-news candle shows >1.5x average volume and >1.2 ATR move
Subsequent 2-4 hour period shows range compression: max range < 0.3 ATR and volume declines to <0.7x average
Price remains within 0.5 ATR of the post-news extreme (high for bullish news, low for bearish news)
4-hour RSI (14) is not >80 (for long) or <20 (for short) at compression end

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.8 ATR move from compression breakout point
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 0.6 ATR move against entry, or a close beyond the opposite bound of the compression range
exit_conditions.time_exit: 12 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups result in a false breakout and swift reversal beyond the compression range, indicating the initial move was an overrejection.
